Old Hickory Whiskey Bar is Pensacola's destination to enjoy over 750 whiskeys, other spirits, and artfully crafted cocktails in a relaxing and engaging atmosphere.
Old Hickory is named after the 7th U.S. President, Andrew Jackson, also the first Territorial Governor of Florida. Nicknamed "Old Hickory" for his toughness in battle, Jackson was imperative to Florida becoming part of the United States in 1821, when he hoisted the American flag over Florida Territory for the first time in Plaza Ferdinand. Jackson's personal residence in Pensacola was actually located just across the street from Old Hickory Whiskey Bar, on the corner of Intendencia Street and Palafox Place.
Old Hickory is owned & operated by Katie Garrett and managed by Joe Couture.
For inquires regarding events, please use the form under the event services page or email us at info@oldhickorywhiskeybar.com
For inquiries regarding bottle sales, please fill out the form above.
online sales: Refunds/replacements for bottles damaged in shipment only. no exchanges.
